meanings.definition: An excessive and dangerous dose of a drug.
meanings.sent1: The patient experienced an overdose after taking too much medication.
meanings.sent2: The overdose of painkillers led to serious health complications.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character comically suffered an overdose of energy drinks.
meanings.sent4: Her love for chocolate was so intense, it was like an overdose of sweetness.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of an overdose can be life-threatening.

meanings.definition: To take an excessive dose of a drug.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally overdosed on his prescription medication.
meanings.sent2: She warned him not to overdose on the sleeping pills.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to overdose on caffeine to stay awake all night.
meanings.sent4: His obsession with work caused him to constantly overdose on stress.
meanings.sent5: It's important to never overdose on any medication.

meanings.definition: To administer an excessive dose of a drug.
meanings.sent1: The nurse mistakenly overdosed the patient with the wrong medication.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian had to be careful not to overdose the small dog.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully threatened to overdose the dish with extra spice.
meanings.sent4: The coach didn't want to overdose the athletes with too much protein.
meanings.sent5: It's crucial for medical professionals to never overdose their patients.
